pageContext.description: Reel-shaped, with large slot through whole width.
pageContext.other: 4-part, hand-drawn illustration.  One dimension indicated., Original title of card struck through.  Current title info written over white-out label in different ink and handwriting from rest of card.
pageContext.associations: Hoard of 32 pieces, Nos. 2490-2520 comprising 14 socketed celts & 3 moulds, 2 gouges & 1 mould, 2 hammers, 2 anvils, 2 knives, 1 whetstone, 1 ?orifice of mould, 1 ?end of bracelet, 2 pieces of metal cakes_
pageContext.publications: Evans, Anc. Br. Imps. pp. 308, 442.  Fig. 377.  Hoard No. 105.,  For full references to hoard, see socketed celt No. 2491.
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT, followed by notation in pencil:, 2
pageContext.remarks: "The stock-in-trade of an ancient bronze founder."  Evans, p. 442., Either chapet [] or mouthpiece of dagger sheath.  See Evans 305.
